form.name: aspnetForm

div.p: Woodland Hills School District will begin transitioning to virtual instruction for all students. We will begin online instruction on Tuesday April 14th. Our actions are consistent with the recommendations of leading health officials on how to limit the spread of COVID-19 and are also consistent with similar decisions made by a number of our peer institutions.

span.p: Woodland Hills School District will begin transitioning to virtual instruction for all students. We will begin online instruction on Tuesday April 14th. Our actions are consistent with the recommendations of leading health officials on how to limit the spread of COVID-19 and are also consistent with similar decisions made by a number of our peer institutions.

span.p: We want to thank you again for all of your support and flexibility during these unprecedented times. To support you further, we have developed some step-by-step instructions below to follow each day with your child(ren) to help them complete their virtual learning. Click Here to read update

p.a: Here is the link to the Daily Attendance Form
Here is an updated letter from the desk of the Superintendent (4-14-2020)

p.span: Please help us determine if a new grab and go location might be needed somewhere, why participation might be low at current sites, and to hear feedback from the community. Here is a link to a quick Survey. Here is a map to see where food distribution sites are located

img.alt: from the desk of the Superintendent

span.p: Here is a message from our Governor and State School Superintendent that all Pennsylvania schools K-12 will be closed the remainder of our school calendar year. (4-9-2020) Click here to read letter
The WH Foundation is partnering with our Chromebook fundraising efforts. The official WH Foundation link is listed below.
Donation reminders when using the donation link:

ul.li: Choose the Woodland Hills Chromebook Donation Link.
In the note line write care of WH-Chromebook.

span.p: Please let us know if you need clarification on any items related to the Woodland Hills Chromebook Donation Drive, partnering with the Woodland Hills Foundation which is a 501C3.
Official letter of intent: Click Here
Click to find out more information about these important human services and opportunities for students and families.

div.p: KOOL Summer Program-for students entering 1st-5th grade in the fall of 2020
Counselor In Training (CIT) Internship-for students entering 9th-12h grade in the fall of 2020
Supports for Success Program-A case management program for adults who need assistance with an employment or education goal.

div.a: WHSD NAMED A 2020 BEST COMMUNITIES FOR MUSIC EDUCATION DISTRICT

span.p: The Woodland Hills School District has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education. Now in its 21st year, the Best Communities for Music Education designation is awarded to districts that demonstrate outstanding achievement in efforts to provide music access and education to all students.

div.a: Mikey and Bob's Spectacular Super Special Stand Out Student Award

span.p: Congratulations to Emma Papariella of Woodland Hills High School. She is the latest recipient of the Mikey and Bob's Spectacular Super Special Stand Out Student Award presented by UPMC. Emma was nominated by Mr. Bob Ralston, the Transition Coordinator at Woodland Hills HS.

p.span: Students, teachers, administrators and parents please take a few minutes to complete the BrightBytes technology survey. Your answers will help us improve the use of technology for teaching and learning
